algorithm: My new algorithm calculates the scores for bin assignment by taking the element-wise product of the reciprocal of the rest capacities of each bin and the ratio of the item size to the maximum bin capacity, then subtracting the reciprocal of the maximum bin capacity minus the item size. Finally, the scores are calculated as the square root of the result, and the final scores are sorted in descending order.
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item, bins):
    max_capacity = np.max(bins)
    ratio = item / max_capacity
    rest_capacity_reciprocal = 1 / bins
    inverse_max_capacity_minus_item = 1 / (max_capacity - item)
    
    scores = np.sqrt(rest_capacity_reciprocal * ratio - inverse_max_capacity_minus_item)
    sorted_scores = np.sort(scores)[::-1]
    return scores
